body:
If the user loads a deck with a card that does not exist in the game, the program crashes. Previously, the program silently ignores such cards.

A better solution is to load the card but indicate in the deck list that the card is not supported. Possibly by extending MagicPlayer to include a deck of unknown cards and displaying that in the deck list in red or strikethrough.
author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
title: add handling of cards not supported by the game
content:
_From [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/) on September 18, 2011 10:29:42_

If the user loads a deck with a card that does not exist in the game, the program crashes. Previously, the program silently ignores such cards.

A better solution is to load the card but indicate in the deck list that the card is not supported. Possibly by extending MagicPlayer to include a deck of unknown cards and displaying that in the deck list in red or strikethrough.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=54_
